clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Involvement of IL-17 / IL-22 Pathway in Bacterial Exacerbations of COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Involvement of IL-17 / IL-22 Pathway in Bacterial Exacerbations of COPD

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a worldwide chronic inflammatory disease of the airways linked to environmental exposure. The chronic course of COPD is often interrupted by acute exacerbations which have a major impact on the morbidity and mortality of COPD patients. A bacterial etiology for these exacerbations is common (almost 50%). Moreover, airway bacterial colonization linked to an increased susceptibility is observed in COPD patients. Effective Th17 immune response is needed to develop a good response against bacteria. Thus, this study aims to demonstrate that there is a defective IL-17/ IL-22 response to bacteria in COPD leading to airway bacterial colonization and infection.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
primary_outcome.description: Compare the delta of IL-17 and IL-22 cytokines between exacerbation and steady-state in the sputum,between the two groups of patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the delta of IL-17 and IL-22 cytokines between exacerbation and steady-state in the blood.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure cytokines by ELISA in the blood at exacerbation and at steady-state. Compare the delta of these cytokines between the two groups of patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify IL-17 and IL-22 producing cells in the blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Identify by flow cytometry, IL-17 and/or IL-22 positive immune cell types in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify IL-17 and IL-22 producing cells in the sputum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Identify by flow cytometry, IL-17 and/or IL-22 positive immune cell types in the sputum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of immune cell types in the blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantify by flow cytometry different immune cells in the blood: monocytes, macrophages, B and T cells, innate lymphocytes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of immune cell types in the sputum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantify by flow cytometry different immune cells in the sputum: monocytes, macrophages, B and T cells, innate lymphocytes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of pro-inflammatory cytokines in blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantify by ELISA Th1 (IL-12, IFN gamma), Th2 (IL-4, IL-5), Th17 (IL-1 beta, IL-6, IL-23, TGF beta), regulatory (IL-10) and pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-8) in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of pro-inflammatory cytokines in sputum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantify by ELISA Th1 (IL-12, IFN gamma), Th2 (IL-4, IL-5), Th17 (IL-1 beta, IL-6, IL-23, TGF beta), regulatory (IL-10) and pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-8) in the sputum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify pathogens linked to the exacerbation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation)
secondary_outcome.description: Research of classical bacteria and fungi by usual microbial cultures from sputum and of respiratory virus and non conventional bacteria (Mycoplasma, Legionella, Bordetella pertussis and parapertussis and Chlamydophila pneumoniae) by PCR on nasopharyngeal swab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify persistent pathogens at steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Research of classical bacteria and fungi by usual microbial cultures from sputum and of respiratory virus and non conventional bacteria (Mycoplasma, Legionella, Bordetella pertussis and parapertussis and Chlamydophila pneumoniae) by PCR on nasopharyngeal swab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare sputum microbiota between exacerbation and steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Metagenomic analysis on sputum

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare oxidative stress in the blood between exacerbation and steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification by ELISA in the blood of oxidative stress markers (isoprostane, superoxyde dismutase, 3-nitrotyrosine, peroxyde, catalase).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of oxidative stress in exhaled condensates
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation) and between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification by ELISA of nitrite species in exhaled condensates.

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe exacerbation phenotype
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation)
secondary_outcome.description: Collect respiratory symptoms, received treatments and hospitalization duration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe environmental exposure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation), between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Collect informations on the patient's occupation, occupational exposures and smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe COPD clinical phenotype
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation), between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Collect morphological informations, history of exacerbations

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe COPD radiological phenotype
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state)
secondary_outcome.description: Realization of a chest CT scan if not performed during the 2 previous years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantify Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation), between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Realization of the COPD Assessment Test (CAT), a quality of life questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe COPD treatments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (exacerbation), between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Collect informations on treatments related to COPD including inhaled treatments, influenza and pneumococcal vaccinations, oxygen therapy and respiratory rehabilitation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure static lung function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Test the lung function with spirometry and plethysmography repeated annually to measure the decline of respiratory function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure airway resistances
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and at 2 and 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Measure resistances with the forced oscillation technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure exercise tolerance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion (end of the hospitalization for exacerbation), between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and annually for 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Perform a 6-minute walk-test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis exercise tolerance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between 8 to 16 weeks (steady-state) and at 2 and 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Perform a cardiopulmonary exercise test on a bicycle.

arm_group.description: Patients with at least 10^7 UFC/ml bacteria in their sputum during their first COPD exacerbation.
Patients without detected bacteria or below 10^7 UFC/ml in sputum during their first COPD exacerbation.

intervention.description: Collect sputum, blood and nasopharyngeal swab during the exacerbation and at steady state 8 to 16 weeks later.
Measure lung function and follow it during 4 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed COPD according GOLD guidelines
- Current or ex-smoker (at least 10 pack-years)
- Hospitalized for COPD exacerbation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Asthma or Cystic fibrosis
- No other chronic lung disease
- Solid Tumor unhealed or not considered in remission
- Inhaled drug consumption
- Women of childbearing potential without effective contraception
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Incapable of consent
- Lack of social security coverage
